column1: brethil is a Sindarin word meaning "beech-tree"
The ordinary Sindarin word for birch was chwind or chwind.
brethil is derived from the Sundocarmë BERÉTH
column2: and is probably related to Gnomish bridh(n)ir ("queen

column1: The word should not be related to brethil "daughter of the Queen; princess" which obviously derives from bereth (root BARAT).
